alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 08 at 3:20AM PST until January 08 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves with dangerous rip currents. High surf of 4 to 7 feet. Local sets to 10 feet. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Ventura County Beaches and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Enhanced beach erosion is also possible across the Ventura Coast and around Point Conception with minor beach flooding.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches
